data.title: GPS Bug
data.body:
Just played two games, in one the GPS took about 4.4 minutes to "activate" after the satellite was lauched, in the second game it never did (I forfeited after a fair amount of time, opponent's GPS which lauched well after mine was working btw).  Looks like a bug.

version:latest bleed

data.title: ScrollPanelWidget - Fix frame end task race condition
data.body:
This fixes #12271, which seems to be caused by a race condition. The global chat history or nickname panel has a chance to pass in `null` for `Game.GlobalChat.History` or `Game.GlobalChat.Users` during binding. What this will do is set `collection = null`, and `BindingRefresh()` would get caught with an NRE. What's interesting to me is it seemed like:
- Event bindings on `collection` are being cleared.
- `Collection` is being set null.
- For some reason, the event `BindingRefresh` still gets called, even though this event is not bound if `c == null` (I am assuming RunAfterTick causes this behavior).

I didn't go with adding a null check inside of `BindingRefresh` since it felt like a symptom of the problem, and I'm starting to get familiar with the scroll panel widget.

data.title: Fix Lua error message for WPos subtraction
data.body: This updates the Lua error message shown if a script screws up subtracting a WPos, and also fixes one of the `string.Format` parameters. Is similar to how the CPos message was changed in #12156.

data.title: Installer metadata origin registry keys only work for 64 bit installs
data.body: Installs on 32 bit windows / wine use a different prefix: `HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\EA Games\`.

data.title: Activities re-write, part 1 (aka the boring bits)
data.body:
I thought I'd start easy to get at least some progress on this.

A future PR will remove the many duplicated `Cancel` methods as well for activities that have inner activities.

data.title: Can't get to menu after loosing connection
data.body:
When connection to a server is lost and the "Connection Lost..." message box is shown, it seems impossible to exit the game without crashing it (Alt+F4) sometimes (always?).

I first noticed it on the 20161015 and I'm fairly sure it was possible to get to the main menu by pressing Esc earlier.

Using Linux Mint.
Sorry if I'm just confused and it's not new.

data.title: Get rid of DelayedAction in Beacons and PlaceBuilding
data.body: Replacing it with `Tick`-based solutions.

data.title: Refactor Shroud and shroud-modifying traits
data.body:
To support upgradability of `AffectsShroud`-derivatives and improve flexibility of `Shroud` itself.

Code changes split from #12267 (which serves as test-case until this is merged).

data.title: Add plumbing for improved RA gap generator behaviour.
data.body:
The RA gap generators have never worked very well in our RA mod â€“ our additions of the fog of war, initially explored map, and (until recently) GPS satellite dots made them relatively useless.

We had planned to make them more useful by actively blocking unit sight instead of just turning a circle of fog into shroud.  Not surprisingly... nobody wanted to actually code the feature, so it fell off the radar and other easier changes were made instead (changing "Disable Shroud" → "Explore Map", hiding GPS dots, etc).

~~#12267~~ #12308 added the last real prerequisite for this (supporting multiple `RevealsShroud` traits on an actor), so I feel this is the right time to try and push this feature through.

This reorganizes the internal `Shroud` plumbing to reduce duplication and adds a new "passive" reveal type that has lower precedence than generated shroud.  ~~The RA mod rules are then updated to give all actors half their normal vision range for gap-generated cells.~~

The effect ingame looks like this (gap generator is to the left of the tank):
![gap2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/19705218/25835be8-9b03-11e6-9f20-f194b7ddf0a1.png)

data.title: Replace DelayedAction in GpsWatcher with Tick-based solution
data.body:
This is the first of multiple `DelayedAction`-removing PRs.

GPS is probably amongst the most fragile pieces of code in OpenRA, so this gets its own PR in order to not block easier cases.

data.title: help to repair and script the map i made
data.body:
I made a map with a lot of effort. Took me a coule of months to create it so that it is as beatufull as possible, that it is balanced for both teams qua ore placement and such. But the idea of the map is to make a map that looks like the standard map of league of legends but then in red alert. I have a lot of requests for scripting and i would like to get help with that as i am not able to do the scripting. if this is not possible (when i can get contact with somewone willing to do this for me) then my request is just to repair the map and upload it without the scripting, aswell as some coorperation in taking a look at the map for improvements. Plzz let me know if there is someone willing to do this and give me an email so i can send it to you. The map that i have on my pc crashes now all the time i try to loadit even in skirmisch mode. So i think that has to do with some updates that came in later on. Besides that a guy named zjordy tried to script it and uplaod it but he did a terrible job at it. and uploaded the map while its completely wrongly scripted, it crashes, and he quited half way the attempt to finish it. The map name is Summoners rift. the same name of the map in league of legends.  (so maybe you  can find it allready online, but that is the uploaded version with the crappy scripting of zjordy. Sorry if i insult zjordy with this. that is not my intention. I just want to finish this map on which i put so much effor in to make it). TIf there is someone willing to help me with this i will send my requests for scripting through email. and ofcource the map that i have on my pc. Forward thatns for the one, if there is someone, willing to help me with this. Sorry for the long story. i just took my medication and im kinda buzzed out :/ anyway i hope to get a reaction soon

cheers Leander Letwory (gamename Ohmk Torque

data.title: ranking system
data.body:
I really think (and i asked a lot in the lobby, lots of ppl agree) that you guys should imply a ranking system to insure that the matches are allways balanced. Like in league of legends. A sort of system where ppl get a higher or lower rank based on their results of winning and losing. And then make sure that all the ppl with the same rank are put together against eachother ina fight. It is a thing that happens so often that the matches ate so unbalanced, making ppl leave the match early. or ragequit. I wonder what you guys think of this idea. Plzz let me know

cheers, Leander Letworry (game name Ohmk Torque)

data.title: Restructuring make script
data.body:
In addiction to restructuring I have also made the "all" command fetch dependencies.

I believe this structure is more readable and obvious, but if you think this structure is not proper for powershell LMK and I'll make a separate PR just for adding the dependencies to the "all" command.

data.title: Update CONTRIBUTING.md
data.body: Fixed single-character typo in contibuting guide. 'youself' -> 'yourself'

data.title: Odd start up crash if no audio output is connected
data.body:
I recently had an very odd behaviour with the newest version of OpenRA on two Windows8 systems:

While both do have an audio device, the game only starts when there is actually an output connected to them (for example headphones). Otherwise it crashes with some OpenAL error in the graphics logs.

No idea how to fix that, but it seems like an small error that is easy to overlook during development, but that caused me some considerable frustration.

data.title: Server.Timeout is not reset after a game ends
data.body:
Timers (if enabled) are created and then forgotten about and never cleaned up.  They will then eventually kill the server after the timeout, even if the current game has been active for only a short amount of time.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L707

All server operators should disable the timeout feature to avoid this game-killing bug.

data.title: Fix null being passed through the INotifyAttack interface
data.body:
[`SwallowActor` explicitly passes a `null` `Armament` to `INotifyAttack.PreparingAttack`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/634faa31deb9e03ed7b49b06c9b6ade0225bcb01/OpenRA.Mods.D2k/Activities/SwallowActor.cs#L96) which then gets redirected in [`WithInfantryBody`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithInfantryBody.cs#L128) to its `Attacking` method causing a crash.

I need the explicit `string sequence = null` as I otherwise get a `CS0165` compiler error.

Detected by Coverity.
